post.title: Startup Spotlight: MoneyAfrica
post.excerpt: It is a financial literacy company that teaches you everything you need to know about money.
post.content:
Money Africa, founded in 2018 by Oluwatosin Olaseinde, is a subscription-based financial edtech platform. It is a financial literacy company that teaches you everything you need to know about money. The platform is built just for people and covers everything from treasury bills to currency risk, investing in local and foreign stock, government bonds, asset allocation, agric tech, etc. Its mission is straightforward: to guide individuals on how to grow and make money sustainably. 

In 2022, Money Africa partnered with Ingressive for Good to boost financial awareness among African women. They successfully trained over 10,000 women in investing and financial planning. Their latest venture, MoneyAfrica Kids, is designed for children aged 7 to 18. It is designed to teach kids about saving, budgeting, and making wise financial choices.

node.title: Rose-Margaret Ekeng-Itua has become the first black woman to hold a PhD in Cybernetics
node.excerpt: An award-winning Nigerian Professor, Rose-Margaret Ekeng-Itua, has emerged as the first black woman in the world to earn a doctorate (PhD) in Cybernetics, which is the scientific study of control and communication in animals and machines, concerned with understanding complex systems like learning, cognition, adaptation, emergence, communication, and efficiency. node.title: Tech Sales vs Business Development
node.excerpt: Tech sales and Business development are important for generating revenue for companies in the tech industry.
